intro: Galeatella gloria-montis f. sanguinea, commonly known as the crimson glory bellflower, is a rare and striking cultivar of the genus Galeatella. It is characterized by its vibrant red to purple flowers, which bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant is a herbaceous perennial, typically growing to a height of 12–18 inches, with lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with silver. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a desirable addition to rock gardens or alpine beds. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens and botanical collections.
